Hi everyone, I’m Charlotte - Ops Manager at Polyteia (German GovTech). Nice to meet y’all!
I have a question regarding integrating our own data platform with HubSpot, can you point me to the right channel to ask that question? Thanks!
if you do end up using it, I'd suggest self hosting it instead of using a CDN
You can try the <#C2YHAHB6K|api> channel if the question is more technical in nature.
<@U042E0SGACU> What type of data are you trying to integrate?

I’ll just put it in here, was in a little doubt if it should be here or in <#C22PDRW72|data-driven-content> or maybe it should be discussed somewhere else. so the thing is, I’d like to know what the best way is to create a personal customer type of web page where customers can check their HubSpot deal property values.

So a page where customers :
• need to login (i know this is a feature in HubSpot) 
• see their contact and /or deal properties (dont know how to do this, do we need the API for this?)
Looking forward to your findings :+1:

Hey Micheal, Yes you can definitely do this with CMS powered GraphQL pages. <#C22PDRW72|data-driven-content> Is going to be the best place to put this moving forward because that is where all the GraphQL nerds reside (myself very much included).
haha right, i’ll move it there! thanks carter
For sure
Hello, is it possible to position the HubSpot chat widget at the top of the browser? let say for this instance on the navbar?
Technically yes, you would just need to write the css yourself
:open_mouth: No way. I tried using the inspect element and changing the css but I had no luck.
Do you want a button on the nav bar to open the chat widget

Also you can use the Inline embed selector so that you can pick which element the chat widget embeds in:
```Inline embed selector	"inlineEmbedSelector":	Where the widget should be embedded in the page. If a selector (e.g. #some-id) is provided, the widget will be embedded inline within that DOM node. It will always be open until it is removed via widget.remove```
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/conversations_api/hsconversationssettings>
So the on mobile view the HubSpot chat widget is in the nav bar and ppl cant click on the chat icon to open the widget

With the CLI is it possible to fetch/clone default modules?
I tried `hs fetch "@HubSpot/linked_image" "my-theme/modules/custom_image.module"` with no success.
"@HubSpot/linked_image" was not found in account XXXXXXX.
Interesting. Can you share a screenshot?

Ah, figured out my mistake!

It should be `hs fetch "@HubSpot/linked_image.module" "my-theme/modules/custom_image.module"`
Has anybody tried to create a custom Quote template that could be downloaded as a .csv file?

HI everyone, in case we don’t connect on Linkedin or you can’t read my mind, I wanted to share something I’ve been thinking about for a while and hopefully can get going for early next year!!

Myself and some other community members really think that in person developer time where everyone can network and digest some content that is community sourced tailored to everyone in the community. That is why some of us are really interested in a community sourced (non hs related) event would be a really great thing for everyone.

I have some more information in my linked in post that I made after talking with some developers at Inbound and I also have a sign up place where I can start seeing who would like to be involved. Please read the linkedin post and then fill out the form if you are interested in helping or just attending, even if it is virtual! We really think we can make this great

<https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6974208057534734336/>

<https://deckerdevs.com/HubSpot-developer-community-day>

I’d encourage you to share this with anyone that would be interested in helping or attending, I think we can make something really awesome the community can be proud of
interesting! i'm curious if the intent is to focus solely on CMS development or if this would include opportunities for CRM developers to get involved/collaborate?
Why can I make HubDB tables on my free account? Isn't it a tiered feature? Or am I simply able to make them, but unable to actually query/access the data?

B-b-but then I would have to go actually outside. :pleading_face::point_right::point_left:
But, no, sounds awesome. I would like to start it off early by casting my vote for the first gathering to take place in Tampa, Florida ~since it's near my home~ because it's a great developer hub location. EDIT: Oh, I see you already voted for south Florida. :laughing:
<@U02M9GZTEGH> great question! We want to do it all. If you can help spread the word we'd love to have people join up and participate!!

<@U0429V78FDK> Tampa is 2 hours north of where I live and is reasonable. We've got quite a few people in south Florida down here that are going to be participating so we'll be looking for cost effective options that check some other boxes as well. Tampa isn't out of the possibilities

Hi everyone :slightly_smiling_face:

I have a question about using the form on the page - the same, but in two places - top and bottom.
I have a problem with this, because when filling in the form, I select marketing consents in the bottom form - it takes me to the top form and this consent is selected there.

I would like to add that I put the forms into the html file of the page in the form of 2 separate modules (but the fact - the form / id is the same).

Anyone had a similar case? Did you manage to solve it somehow?
I will be very grateful for the answers :slightly_smiling_face:
